data.title: Q&A
data.meta_description: Roberta Taylor, now in her mid-50s, was raised in east London. She married young and had a son. After a stint as a dental nurse, she went to drama school at the age of 24 to become an actress. From 1997â€¦
data.text:
Roberta Taylor, now in her mid-50s, was raised in east London. She married young and had a son. After a stint as a dental nurse, she went to drama school at the age of 24 to become an actress. From 1997 to 2000, she played Irene in EastEnders; she now plays Inspector Gina Gold in The Bill. She lives in London with her second husband.

What is your idea of perfect happiness?

Waking up without an alarm.

What is your greatest fear?

My plane crashing in the jungle - eat me first, please.

Which living person do you most admire?

Anyone on the minimum wage.

What is the trait you most deplore in yourself?

Wasting time.

What is the trait you most deplore in others?

People who kidnap other people's grief to enjoy the limelight. Ugh!

Where would you like to live?

Jeffrey Archer's place looking over the Thames.

What do you most dislike about your appearance?

My feet.

What is your favourite fantasy?

That Marlon Brando was in love with me all along.

How did you vote in the last election?

Labour.

How will you vote in the next election?

Not sure.

For what cause would you die?

No cause - though I would stand in front of my son if he was in danger, if he'd let me.

Do you believe in monogamy?

I have a go.

Which living person do you most despise?

George Bush - what a waste of an expensive education.

What do you consider the most overrated virtue?

All virtues are overrated.

Which words or phrases do you most overuse?

'What a c***!'

What is your greatest regret?

That I didn't listen to my mother enough.

How do you relax?

Scrabble mixed with wine.

What would your motto be?

Get on with it.

What keeps you awake at night?

Burglar alarms.

How would you like to die?

I wouldn't.

How would you like to be remembered?

As a bit of a laugh.

What is the most important lesson life has taught you?

You can never ask too many questions.
